en: Praise ye Jehovah. Oh give thanks unto Jehovah; for he is good; For his lovingkindness endureth for ever.
hmr: LALPA chu inpâk ro, LALPA kuoma chun lâwm- thu hril ro, ama chu a ṭha sih a; A ngilneina chun kumkhuo a dai sih a.

en: Who can utter the mighty acts of Jehovah, Or show forth all his praise?
hmr: Tu am LALPA thilthaw ropuitakhai hril thei a, Ama inpâkna po po inhriettir vawng thei le?

en: Blessed are they that keep justice, And he that doeth righteousness at all times.
hmr: Rorêlna vawng ṭhahai chu an hamṭha ie, Ieng lai khawma feltaka thawtu leh.

en: Remember me, O Jehovah, with the favor that thou bearest unto thy people; Oh visit me with thy salvation,
hmr: Aw LALPA, i mihai i ditsakna chun mi hre zing la, Aw i Sandamna leh mi hung kan rawh.

en: That I may see the prosperity of thy chosen, That I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, That I may glory with thine inheritance.
hmr: I mi thlanghai tluongtlungzie ka hmu thei a, I hnamhai lâwmnaa chun ka hlim thei a, I rochanhai le ka sawng theina dingin.

en: We have sinned with our fathers, We have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
hmr: Kan thlatuhai le khan thil kan suksuol a, Thil suol kan thawh a, suoltakin kan thaw tah a.

en: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; They remembered not the multitude of thy lovingkindnesses, But were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea.
hmr: Kan thlatuhai khan Aigupta rama khan i thilmak thaw- hai kha an hriet thiem nawh a, I ngilneina nasatak kha an hriet zing ta nawh a, Tuisuorietah an hel ta lem a, Tuisuoriet Sena khan.

en: Nevertheless he saved them for his name’s sake, That he might make his mighty power to be known.
hmr: Chuong sa khawm chun ama hming leiin anni chu a sandam tah a, A thilthawtheina ropuitak chu ân hriettir theina dingin.

en: He rebuked the Red Sea also, and it was dried up: So he led them through the depths, as through a wilderness.
hmr: Tuisuoriet Sen chu a hal a; chuongchun, a kang tah a, Chuongchun, anni chu thlalêra ṭhuoi tlang ang elin tui inthûktakahai chun a ṭhuoi tlang tah a.

en: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, And redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
hmr: Anni theidatu kuta inthawk chun a sandam a, Hmêlma kuta inthawk chun ân tlan tah a.

en: And the waters covered their adversaries; There was not one of them left.
hmr: Tuihai chun anni dotuhai chu ân khum zo a, Pakhat khawm dama suok an um ta nawh a.

en: Then believed they his words; They sang his praise.
hmr: Chuong lai chun a thuhai chu an ring a, Ama inpâkna hla an sak a.

en: They soon forgat his works; They waited not for his counsel,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, a thilthaw- hai chu an theinghil vak tah a, A remruot chu an nghâk pei nawh a.

en: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, And tempted God in the desert.
hmr: Thlalêra chun thil an châk êm êm a, Ram ṭâwla chun Pathien an fie ta lem a.

en: And he gave them their request, But sent leanness into their soul.
hmr: An thil hni chu a pêk a, Nisienlakhawm, an hringnaa chun chêrna ân lûttir a,

en: They envied Moses also in the camp, And Aaron the saint of Jehovah.
hmr: An riebûka chun Mosie chu an îtthîk a, LALPA mi inthieng, Aron leh.

en: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, And covered the company of Abiram.
hmr: Hnuoi chu a kah a, Dathan chu a lem a, Abiram pâwlhai chu ân khum zo tah a.

en: And a fire was kindled in their company; The flame burned up the wicked.
hmr: An pâwl lai chun mei sukchawkin a um a, Meichawk chun mi rilohai chu a kâng hmang tah a.

en: They made a calf in Horeb, And worshipped a molten image.
hmr: Horeb tlânga chun bâwngte lim an siem a, A lim sung chu an biek tah a.

en: Thus they changed their glory For the likeness of an ox that eateth grass.
hmr: Chuong ang chun an ropuina chu, Bâwngchal hlobet fa mi ang chauah an inchangtir tah a.

en: They forgat God their Saviour, Who had done great things in Egypt,
hmr: Pathien an sandamtu an theinghil tah a, Aigupta rama thil ropuitak tak thawtu chu;

en: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, And terrible things by the Red Sea.
hmr: Ham rama thilmaktakhai, Tuisuoriet Sen panga thil râpthlâktakhai thawtu chu.

en: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, Had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, To turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
hmr: Chuleiin, sukbohmang rawi a tih, tia, a lunginsen sukkîr dingin, A mi thlang Mosie chu a lûtna dinga chun a hmaah ngîr naw sien lem chu, Sukbohmang a tih, ti a hril a.

en: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, They believed not his word,
hmr: Anih, ram ditumtak chu an ngainêp a, A thu chu an ring nuom nawh a.

en: But murmured in their tents, And hearkened not unto the voice of Jehovah.
hmr: An puon inahai chun an chier ta lem a, LALPA râwl chu an ngai nuom nawh a.

en: Therefore he sware unto them, That he would overthrow them in the wilderness,
hmr: Chuleiin anni tieng chun a kut a phar a, Anni chu thlalêra sukthlûkna ding le,

en: And that he would overthrow their seed among the nations, And scatter them in the lands.
hmr: An chi thla dinghai chu hnam tin lai a sukthlûk a, Ram tina a sukdarna dingin.

en: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, And ate the sacrifices of the dead.
hmr: Baal-peor tieng chun an kawp a, Mithi kuoma thilinhlânhai chu an fâk ve tah a.

en: Thus they provoked him to anger with their doings; And the plague brake in upon them.
hmr: Chuongchun, an thilthawhaiin ama chu an suklungsen a, Chuongchun, hri chu an chungah a hung inlêng tah a.

en: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment; And so the plague was stayed.
hmr: Chuong lai chun Phinehas chu a ngîr a, ro a rêl a; Chuongchun, hri chu sukboin a um tah a.

en: And that was reckoned unto him for righteousness, Unto all generations for evermore.
hmr: Chu chu a felnaa ruot a nih, Kumkhuoin suon po po chenin.

en: They angered him also at the waters of Meribah, So that it went ill with Moses for their sakes;
hmr: Meriba tuiahai khawm chun ama chu an suklungsen a, Chuongchun, anni leiin Mosie chungah thil ṭha naw a tlung ta hiel a,

en: Because they were rebellious against his spirit, And he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
hmr: A thlarau chungah an hel a, A hmûra ṭha nawtaka a hril leiin.

en: They did not destroy the peoples, As Jehovah commanded them,
hmr: LALPAIN an kuoma sukbo- hmangna thu a pêk angin, Mipuihai chu an sukbohmang nawh a.

en: But mingled themselves with the nations, And learned their works,
hmr: Hnam tin chu an pâwl a, An thilthawhai chu an inchûk lem a.

en: And served their idols, Which became a snare unto them.
hmr: A milim rawnghai an bâwl a, Chuong chu an ta dingin châng a lo ni tah.

en: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto demons,
hmr: Anih, khawhri kuoma chun an naupasalhai le an naunu- hmeihaiin an inthâwi a;

en: And shed innocent blood, Even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, Whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan; And the land was polluted with blood.
hmr: Thisen pawitâwklo, an naupasalhai le an naunuhmeihai thisen ngei chu an insuo tah a, Chuonghai chun Kanaan ram milimhai kuomah an inthâwi a, Chu ram chu thisenin a lo pawrche tah a.

en: Thus were they defiled with their works, And played the harlot in their doings.
hmr: Chuongchun, an sinthawhaia sukkhawloin an um tah a, An thilthawhaia chun an hung uire tah a.

en: Therefore was the wrath of Jehovah kindled against his people, And he abhorred his inheritance.
hmr: Chuleiin, LALPA lung chu a mihai chungah ân thawk a, A rochan chu a tirdak tah a.

en: And he gave them into the hand of the nations; And they that hated them ruled over them.
hmr: Chuongchun, anni chu hnam tin kutah a pêk a, Anni theidatuhai chun an chungah ro an rêl tah a.

en: Their enemies also oppressed them, And they were brought into subjection under their hand.
hmr: Anni dotuhaiin an nêksâwr a, An kut hnuoia chun suktlâwmin an um tah a.

en: Many times did he deliver them; But they were rebellious in their counsel, And were brought low in their iniquity.
hmr: Vawi tamtak anni chu a san- dam a, Nisienlakhawm, an remruotnaa chun an hel hlak a, An rîtlonaa chun sukhnuoiin an um tah a.

en: Nevertheless he regarded their distress, When he heard their cry:
hmr: Chuong sa khawm chun, ama chun an khêkri chu a hriet chun, An lunginzîng chu a ngaisak a.

en: And he remembered for them his covenant, And repented according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.
hmr: A thuthlung chu anni a hrietpêk zing a, A ngilneina nasatzie ang peiin a lungril ân lêt tah a.

en: He made them also to be pitied Of all those that carried them captive.
hmr: Sala ṭhuoituhai po po chu, Anni a lunginsiettir a.

en: Save us, O Jehovah our God, And gather us from among the nations, To give thanks unto thy holy name, And to triumph in thy praise.
hmr: Aw LALPA, kan Pathien, mi sandam la, Hnam tin laia inthawk hi mi ṭhuoi khawm rawh: I hming inthieng kuoma lâwmthu hril ding le, Nangma inpâkna chawimawi dingin.

en: Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel, From everlasting even to everlasting. And let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA Israel Pathien chu inpâkin um raw se. Chatuona inthawka chatuon chenin. Mi po po chun, “Amen,” ti raw se; LALPA chu inpâk ro.
